Data: {"recipient_id": "563dd304-facc-4660-8cd8-14fd0b830f70", "custom": {"attachment": {"type": "template", "payload": {"template_type": "simple_form", "title": "Information for Ad Support Ticket", "description": "This form is used to collect user information in case the user needs additional help and a Jira Ticket needs to be filed with our Support Team.", "descriptionPosition": "top", "hidden_reply": true, "reply_text": "The user completes the submission of the form", "submit_button_title": "Send", "intent_name": "submit_form", "cancel_button": {"title": "Cancel", "type": "postback", "payload": "/cancel_for_input_data", "url": null, "is_enabled": false, "hidden_reply": true}, "is_mailerlite_form": false, "fields": [{"title": "Name", "type": "text", "icon_url": "https://seachat.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/images/icon-name.svg", "is_required": true, "entity_name": "_NAME"}, {"title": "Email", "type": "text", "icon_url": "https://seachat.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/images/icon-email.svg", "is_required": true, "entity_name": "_EMAIL"}, {"title": "Account ID", "type": "text", "icon_url": "", "is_required": true, "entity_name": "VAR_0001"}], "form_id": "ee27568f0b9f4826a7215c8197548501"}}}}

Message: Hi, Iâ€™m the NewsBreak Ad Assistant. How can I help?
The user completes the submission of the form
Can I talk with some one
I'm here to help with whatever you need! Let me know your question, and I'll do my best to assist you right away.
someone was supposed to get back with me concerning an ad

If you're waiting for a response regarding your ad, I recommend checking your email for any updates from adsupport@newsbreak.com. They usually send details about ad status or any required actions. If you haven't received anything yet, you might want to reach out to them directly for more information.
Also I was trying to advertise in just one state but look I'm advertising in another state I didn't requested

It sounds like there might be an issue with your targeting settings. I recommend checking your campaign settings in the 'Ad Management' section to ensure that the correct state is selected for your ads. If you need further assistance, you can reach out to adsupport@newsbreak.com for help with adjusting your targeting.
I already sent an email yesterday

Thanks for letting me know. It might take a couple of days for the support team to get back to you. If you don't hear from them soon, you can try following up with another email to adsupport@newsbreak.com. They should be able to assist you with your ad targeting issue.
Okay I just going to turn the ad off for now

That sounds like a good plan if you're experiencing issues with the ad targeting. You can pause or turn off your ad in the 'Ad Management' section until you get the targeting sorted out. If you need any help with this, feel free to reach out!
Can I chat with a team member
While I can't connect you directly with a team member, I'm here to help with any questions or issues you might have. Let me know what you need assistance with, and I'll do my best to guide you!
Do You have a video how to select location

I don't have a video available, but I can guide you through the process of selecting a location for your ad targeting. You can adjust your targeting settings in the 'Ad Management' section by specifying the desired state or region. If you need detailed instructions, feel free to ask!
yes

Great! To select a location for your ad targeting, follow these steps:

1. Go to the 'Ad Management' section.
2. Click on the campaign you want to edit.
3. Look for the targeting settings where you can specify the location.
4. Choose the state or region you want to target.
5. Save your changes.

If you have any more questions or need further assistance, just let me know!
I already did that; how can I be sure it's targeting that location

To ensure your ad is targeting the correct location, you can double-check the targeting settings in your campaign. Here's how:

1. Go to 'Ad Management' and select your campaign.
2. Review the targeting settings to confirm the selected location.
3. Check any reports or analytics available to see if impressions are being served in the desired area.

If everything looks correct but you're still unsure, you might want to reach out to adsupport@newsbreak.com for further verification.
How do you pause ad

To pause your ad, follow these steps:

1. Go to the 'Ad Management' section.
2. Find the campaign or ad set you want to pause.
3. Click on the option to pause or deactivate the ad.
4. Confirm your action if prompted.

This will stop your ad from running until you're ready to resume it. If you need more help, feel free to ask!
Is it the red and white button

Yes, the red and white button is typically used to pause or deactivate an ad. Clicking it should stop your ad from running. If you have any more questions or need further assistance, just let me know!
Do I do it there time because I click it off on campaigns but the ad set is  still on

If you've paused the campaign but the ad set is still active, you'll need to pause the ad set separately. Here's how:

1. Go to 'Ad Management' and select the specific ad set.
2. Look for the pause or deactivate button within the ad set settings.
3. Click it to stop the ad set from running.

Make sure both the campaign and ad sets are paused if you want everything to be inactive.
What size is the image ads

For optimal performance, static image ads should be in a 16x9 (horizontal) format. This size tends to work best with NewsBreak's audience. If you have any more questions about ad creatives, feel free to ask!
Wha about 1200 x 628 pixels

The 1200 x 628 pixel size is a common format for horizontal image ads and should work well within the 16x9 aspect ratio. This size is suitable for NewsBreak's platform. If you have any more questions or need further assistance, feel free to ask!
Is the ads shows on desktop and mobile

Yes, ads on NewsBreak can be shown on both desktop and mobile platforms. The platform is designed to optimize ad placements across different devices, ensuring your ads reach the intended audience effectively. If you have any more questions, feel free to ask!
